DOC.brief_summary: Monocytes may be separated into phenotypically and functionally distinct cell types by the presence or absence of the lipopolysaccharide receptor CD14 and the FcÎ³-receptor CD16. The investigators hypothesize that the total numbers of CD16+ monocytes are significantly related to cardiovascular outcome in patients with angiographically proven coronary heart disease.
DOC.brief_title: CD16+ Monocytes in Coronary Heart Disease (CHD)
DOC.criteria: angiographically proven coronary heart disease Age > 18 years life expectancy < 12 months inability to participate in the trial (to give written informed consent)
